pages.text: The $(item)Power Crucible$() is the $(thing)Essential Tool of Alchemy$(). Its unique capability to convert matter into its raw $(thing)Alchemical Power$() enables easy access to these powers.$(br2)Additionally, it acts as an ideal medium for $(thing)Transmutations$(0).$(p)Shift-click its icon to see how to make one.

Using $(item)the Crucible$() is simple. The $(item)Device$() must be placed $(thing)In-World$(). Then, the $(item)Device$() may be filled with Water by hand. Due to the Warded Nature of its sides, $(thing)Automated Piping$() regrettably cannot access its interiors.$(br2)$(o)You can empty it with a shift right click.

When Items that bear $(thing)Power$() are added to the $(item)Crucible$(), their $(thing)Power$() is extracted. Usually, this leads to the $(thing)Existential Collapse$() of the item in question, but in certain cases a byproduct is created. $(br2)The presence of $(thing)Power$() in the $(item)Crucible$() can be noted by the tone of the water inside. If Particles begin to escape or surround the crucible, this is evidence of a $(thing)Reaction$() taking place!

$(1)Certain Powers, while within the crucible, may interact with the world around it. This is especially true in the presence of certain $(l:reactive:intro/symbols)symbols$(/l). Artifacts with sufficient spiritual power may even allow the Crucible to accumulate power. $(br2)$(o)$(0)Do not be deceived, however; this is a process easily explained by metallurgic studies.

$(1)For the engineering-oriented: $(p)$(item)Dispensers$(1) are able to both fill and empty $(l:reactive:objects_of_study/bottles)bottles of Power$(/l) when aimed at a Crucible. $(p)A $(item)Hopper$(1) is able to autonomously add items to the Crucible, even from the sides. $(p)Finally, output items bounce out of the Crucible high enough that a stream of Water would be able to catch them.
